cont.entity_a: Plastic clasp broke after a few uses; poor design choice to use plastic near heat.
cont.entity_b: Plastic roller included is not as traditional but functional.

cont.entity_a: Pizzelles are very thick, requiring the lid to be locked down each time.
Included accessories like spoon, cannoli roller, and recipe book were missing.
cont.entity_b: Comes with several recipes that work well.

cont.entity_a: Batter is easy to make and quickly done.
cont.entity_b: Heats up quickly and easy to adjust for desired krumkake outcome.

cont.entity_a: Requires practice to determine the right amount of batter to avoid overflow.

Coating.comm: Non-stick surface makes it easy to clean.

cont.entity_a: Non-stick coating worked well initially but deteriorated over time.
cont.entity_b: Non-stick surface makes it easy to remove krumkake.

cont.entity_a: Green and red indicator lights are unreliable.
cont.entity_b: Durability issues with latch and red light not functioning properly.

cont.entity_a: Makes three pizzelles at a time.
Small pizzelles are ideal for cookie trays and ice cream sandwiches.

cont.entity_b: Temperature control is effective but some units have uneven cooking.

cont.entity_a: Locking arm and handle have durability issues.
cont.entity_b: Some issues with uneven cooking and latch durability.

cont.entity_a: Great for making a variety of flavors and can be used for cannoli shells.
cont.entity_b: Machine is easy to use and adjust, making consistent krumkakes.

cont.entity_a: Some issues with the plastic latch breaking and lack of response from customer service.
The ready light is not reliable.
cont.entity_b: Good for making traditional krumkakes without the mess of stovetop irons.
Bakes unevenly, with one side browning faster than the other. Some users experience uneven cooking, particularly in the center.
